alert.note: Alert for Monroe (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 9:44AM EST until December 18 at 8:12PM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Pennsylvania... Bush Kill At Shoemakers affecting Monroe County. For the Bush Kill...including Shoemakers...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Bush Kill at Shoemakers. * WHEN...Until this evening. * IMPACTS...At 6.0 feet, Route 209 in the Delaware Water Gap National Recreation Area floods. At 7.0 feet, Creek Road near Route 209 and Bushkill Road floods. Flooding increases on Route 209 and is closed. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 AM EST Monday the stage was 5.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this afternoon to a crest of 6.1 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage this afternoon. - Flood stage is 6.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 6.1 feet on 12/25/2020. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (7 am) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Stg Time Date Bush Kill Shoemakers 6.0 5.7 Mon 8 am 4.9 4.2 6.1 1pm 12/18 &&
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued this evening at 815 PM EST.
